medical_history.chief_complaint: Chest infections caused by Propionibacterium acnes in patients with chronic granulomatous disease (CGD).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 developed persistent cough and mild fever at age 10, with imaging revealing a mediastinal mass. Patient 2 presented with chest pain, cough, and fever at age 10, with subsequent findings of alveolar pneumonia. Both patients showed rapid symptom resolution after appropriate antibiotic treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic granulomatous disease (CGD) diagnosed at birth and recurrent bacterial infections in the family, with two siblings having died from similar infections.
medical_history.family_history: CGD diagnosed in one brother and one sister of Patient 1; both siblings experienced recurrent infections leading to death. In Patient 2, CGD was diagnosed in one brother and three sisters, with two sisters dying of severe bacterial infections shortly after birth.
